intro: Cyrtandra × scabrella, commonly known as the hybrid Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant belonging to the Gesneriaceae family. It is a natural hybrid between Cyrtandra scabrella and another Cyrtandra species, resulting in a unique combination of traits. The plant typically produces showy, tubular flowers that are often brightly colored, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, commonly found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its foliage is usually thick and waxy, adapted to retain moisture in humid conditions.
